Class AssetLoader

java.lang.Object
controller.AssetLoader
public class AssetLoader extends Object
Manages all game assets, such as images and animations. This class follows the Singleton pattern to ensure that assets are loaded only once and are accessible globally from a single point.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static Map<String,BufferedImage>
    avatars
    A map to store user avatars, publicly accessible for convenience.

  • Field Details

    • avatars

      public static Map<String,BufferedImage> avatars
      A map to store user avatars, publicly accessible for convenience.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static AssetLoader getInstance()
      Returns the single instance of the AssetLoader, creating it if it doesn't exist.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of AssetLoader.

    • getImage

      public BufferedImage getImage(String key)
      Retrieves a pre-loaded image by its key.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the image to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The BufferedImage associated with the key, or null if not found.

    • loadAvatars

      public void loadAvatars()
      Loads all user avatar images from the resources.

    • getAvatar

      public BufferedImage getAvatar(String id)
      Retrieves a pre-loaded avatar image by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the avatar to retrieve (e.g., "avatar1").
      Returns:
      The BufferedImage for the avatar, or null if not found.

    • loadEnemyAnimations

      public void loadEnemyAnimations()
      Loads and creates animation sets for all enemy types. This method retrieves the necessary sprite sheets and assembles them into EnemyAnimationSet objects, which are then stored for each enemy type.

    • getAnimationsFor

      public EnemyAnimationSet getAnimationsFor(EnemyType type)
      Retrieves the complete set of animations for a specific enemy type.
      Parameters:
      type - The EnemyType for which to get the animations.
      Returns:
      The corresponding EnemyAnimationSet.
